dc:title: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm: Screening
dc:description:
The USPSTF recommends that:
For men aged 65 to 75 years who have ever smoked:
Perform 1-time screening for abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA) with ultrasonography in men who have a history of smoking.
Grade B

For men aged 65 to 75 years who have never smoked:
Selectively offer screening to men who do not have a history of smoking, rather than routinely screening all men in this group
Grade C

For women who have never smoked and have no family history of AAA:
Do not screen women who have never smoked and do not have a family history of AAA.
Grade D

For women aged 65 to 75 years who have ever smoked or have a family history of AAA:
Evidence is insufficient to assess the balance of benefits and harms of screening for AAA with ultrasonography in women aged 65 to 75 years who have ever smoked or have a family history of AAA.
Grade I

koio:hasTest.dc:description: These tests are written to test the accuracy of the knowledge implementation.

koio:hasTest.dc:title: Implementation tests
koio:hasTest.dc:description: These tests are written to test the use of superclass KO to implement this knowledge object.

koio:hasDocumentation.dc:title: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm: Screening
koio:hasDocumentation.dc:description: This is the USPSTF documentation webpage for Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Screening recommendation.

koio:hasDocumentation.dc:title: Using the Prediabetes and Type 2 Diabetes Screening Knowledge Object: A Step-by-Step Tutorial
koio:hasDocumentation.dc:description:
This Google Colab tutorial demonstrates three different ways to use the diabetes-screening knowledge object:
  • using the built-in command-line interface (CLI) service
  • using the python activator
  • using the knowledge object's knowledge representation directly in the code
